resources.string: Select a part to customize it
Main Module is the most important part of your spacecraft. Unlock new Main Modules to make your spacecraft more durable. \n +50 Durability points
Heavily armored Main Module taken from cargo ship. Can withstand significant amount of hits. \n +75 Durability points
Basic steering wing, provides good control over your ship. \n +25 Durability points, +20 Braking points
Steering wing made for heavy use. This wing can take large amount of hits before breaking down but provides poorer control due to its massive weight +35 Durability points, +30 Braking points
Main engine is used to move your spacecraft forward. Upgrade it to new one for more speed and durability \n +25 Durability points, +50 Movement points
Strong main engine taken from cargo ship. This part will definitely make your ship faster. \n +60 Durability points, +60 Movement points

Control Unit is used to move your ship upwards. It is the most important tool for avoiding crashes with asteroids. Upgrade your Control Unit for better control over your spacecraft. +25 Durability points, +40 Steering points
This Control Unit was once used to control a massive cargo ship. Perfect for those who love crashing into things! \n +35 Durability points, +60 Steering points
Do you want to buy this item for %1d gold?
Hello pilot! You must be new here. \nLet me show you couple of things

This is your ship. 
 Main motor moves it forwards automatically. 
All you have to do is press or release your screen 
to use the control unit attached to the bottom. 
You can also buy better parts for your ship from the shop in the main menu.

There is also two types of objects you will see during your journey. 
This one is a regular asteroid. 
Watch out for these since every collision with this 
type of asteroid will reduce your health.

Here is another type of asteroid. 
As you can see, it is entirely golden. 
This is the type of asteroid you should collect. 
The more distance you cover the more gold you get out of each asteroid.
That was my advice for you pilot, now go and enjoy your journey. \nAnd remember, no collisions with those asteroids!
